definition: to pay no attention to/not to mind
(negative prefix)/not/no
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: Zhao Zigeng smiled, and did not care to verbal stimuli "."
sentences.chinese: 趙子庚笑笑，毫不在意並以言語刺激宇文。

sentences.english: The Boxer Band tunes in to historyThe Boxers’ negative image in the West is of little concern.
sentences.chinese: 當地毫不在意義和團在西方人眼中的負面形象。

sentences.english: Worry so many senses, and not care secular reality.
sentences.chinese: 如此的多感善愁，毫不在意世俗。

sentences.english: The farmyard must be moved, I grant you; but I am not aware of anything else.
sentences.chinese: 跟你說吧，那個農家院肯定要遷移，別的我都不在意。

sentences.english: Frank doesn't care if Harry leaves or stays.
sentences.chinese: 佛蘭克根本不在意哈里是去還是留。

sentences.english: Big tech is returning cash to investors, and investors simply don't care.
sentences.chinese: 大型科技公司向投資者返現，但投資者根本就不在意。

sentences.english: What he attends to is a whole, not the minor part that occasionally secedes .
sentences.chinese: 他注視的是整體，對少數偶爾脫離的部分毫不在意。

sentences.english: I was one of those dark-skinned country children who didn't matter.
sentences.chinese: 我作爲一個皮膚很黑的鄉村孩子，他們根本不在意我。

sentences.english: My parents were not interested in whether I went to school or got drunk on white wine." - Die Zeit
sentences.chinese: 我的家人並不在意我是否去學校喝得酩酊大醉。

sentences.english: Is evil to resist an evil equanimity way, seem inattentive those 2 people's identities.
sentences.chinese: 魔御邪平靜道，似乎並不在意那兩人的身份。

sentences.english: Wilbur didn't care. He kept walking toward the pail of slops.
sentences.chinese: 威爾伯不在意，繼續朝泔水桶走去。

sentences.english: So I don't really mind what people say about me.
sentences.chinese: 所以我幷不在意別人對我怎麼說。

sentences.english: The twentysomething women I know aren't bothered about old-style feminism.
sentences.chinese: 我認識的20多歲的女性不在意老式的女權運動。

sentences.english: This made him something of a loner, but he didn't mind.
sentences.chinese: 蘭波成了一個獨行客，不過他並不在意。

sentences.english: Never mind that phones do not belong amidst tableware.
sentences.chinese: 他們毫不在意手機並非餐具。

sentences.english: Farmers pay little attention as the land does not belong to them.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的農民對此很不在意，因爲土地並不屬於他們。

definition: not to care
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
not to mind/unconcerned
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
to care about/to mind
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
to care about/equivalent of 在於|在于[zai4 yu2]
to care about/to take seriously/to take to heart
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to care about/to take offense/to mind
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to dismiss with a laugh/to make light of
indifferent/insignificant
careless/heedless/absent-minded/indifferent
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
